00036 from pcs.packets import ipv4
00037 from pcs.packets import tcp
00038 from pcs.packets import ethernet
00039 import pcs

00041 def main():
00042 
00043     from optparse import OptionParser
00044 
00045     parser = OptionParser()
00046     parser.add_option("-i", "--interface",
00047                       dest="interface", default=None,
00048                       help="Network interface to send on.")
00049 
00050     parser.add_option("-t", "--target",
00051                       dest="ip_target", default=None,
00052                       help="IPv4 target address to lookup.")
00053     
00054     parser.add_option("-s", "--ip_source",
00055                       dest="ip_source", default=None,
00056                       help="IPv4 source address to use.")
00057     
00058     parser.add_option("-d", "--ether_destination",
00059                       dest="ether_destination", default=None,
00060                       help="Ethernet destination address to use.")
00061     
00062     parser.add_option("-e", "--ether_source",
00063                       dest="ether_source", default=None,
00064                       help="Ethernet source address to use.")
00065     
00066     parser.add_option("-o", "--source-port",
00067                       dest="source_port", default=None,
00068                       help="Tcp source port.")
00069     
00070     parser.add_option("-x", "--destination-port",
00071                       dest="destination_port", default=None,
00072                       help="Tcp destination port.")
00073     
00074     (options, args) = parser.parse_args()
00075 
00076     import random
00077 
00078     ipid = random.randrange(1,(1<<16)-1)
00079     tcpsport = random.randrange(50000,60000) #int(options.source_port )
00080     tcpsequence = random.randrange(1,(1<<32)-1)   
00081     output = pcs.PcapConnector(options.interface)
00082 
00083     replyip = None
00084     replytcp = None 
00085     reply = None 
00086     packet = None
00087 
00088  # SYN
00089     what = "SYN"
00090 
00091     ip1 = ipv4.ipv4()
00092 
00093     ip1.version = 4 
00094     ip1.hlen = 5   
00095     ip1.tos = 0     
00096     ip1.id = ++ipid 
00097     ip1.flags = 0 
00098     ip1.offset = 0
00099     ip1.ttl = 64
00100     ip1.protocol = pcs.IPPROTO_TCP
00101     ip1.src = pcs.inet_atol(options.ip_source)
00102     ip1.dst = pcs.inet_atol(options.ip_target)
00103     
00104     tcp1 = tcp.tcp()
00105 
00106     tcp1.sport = tcpsport 
00107     tcp1.dport = int(options.destination_port)
00108     tcp1.sequence = tcpsequence
00109     tcpsequence = tcpsequence + 1  # SYN consumes the sequence
00110     tcp1.ack_number = 0
00111     tcp1.offset = 5
00112     tcp1.urgent = 0
00113     tcp1.ack = 0
00114     tcp1.push = 0
00115     tcp1.reset = 0
00116     tcp1.syn = 1
00117     tcp1.fin = 0
00118     tcp1.window = (1<<16)-1
00119     tcp1.urg_point = 0
00120     #tcp1.options
00121 
00122     tcp1.checksum = tcp_cksum(tcp1 , ip1)
00123 
00124     ip1.length = len(ip1.bytes) + len(tcp1.bytes) 
00125 
00126     # important, only calcs the ip checksum after fill length field
00127     ip1.checksum = ip_cksum(ip1)
00128 
00129     ether1 = ethernet.ethernet()
00130     ether1.src = ethernet.ether_atob(options.ether_source)
00131     ether1.dst = ethernet.ether_atob(options.ether_destination)
00132     ether1.type = 0x800
00133 
00134     packet = pcs.Chain([ether1, ip1, tcp1])
00135     
00136     print "\n%s---------------------------------" % what
00137     print tcp1 
00138     print "---------------------------------"
00139 
00140     out = output.write(packet.bytes, len(packet.bytes))
00141 
00142 ## SYN
00143  # SYN+ACK
00144     what = "SYN+ACK"
00145 
00146     while 1: 
00147         reply = output.read()
00148         packet = ethernet.ethernet(reply)
00149         try: 
00150                 replyip = packet.data
00151                 replytcp = replyip.data
00152                 if (ip1.src==replyip.dst and \
00153                         ip1.dst==replyip.src and \
00154                         tcp1.sport==replytcp.dport and \
00155                         tcp1.dport==replytcp.sport): 
00156                         break
00157         except: #it cannot be a tcp packet (without sport:)
00158                 pass
00159 
00160     print "\n%s---------------------------------" % what
00161     print packet.data.data
00162     print "---------------------------------"
00163

00165  # ACK 134,187

00375 def tcp_cksum(self, ip, data = ""):  #TODO: add this method to pcs tcp.py
00376     """return tcpv4 checksum"""
00377     import struct
00378     total = 0
00379     
00380     tmpip = ipv4.pseudoipv4()
00381     tmpip.src = ip.src
00382     tmpip.dst = ip.dst
00383     tmpip.reserved = 0 
00384     tmpip.protocol = pcs.IPPROTO_TCP
00385     tmpip.length = len(self.getbytes()) + len(data)
00386     pkt = tmpip.getbytes() + self.getbytes() + data
00387     if len(pkt) % 2 == 1:
00388         pkt += "\0"
00389     for i in range(len(pkt)/2):
00390         total += (struct.unpack("!H", pkt[2*i:2*i+2])[0])
00391     total = (total >> 16) + (total & 0xffff)
00392     total += total >> 16
00393     return  ~total & 0xffff
00394 
00395 def ip_cksum(self):    #TODO: solve the self problem, may be adding another arg
00396     """calculate the IPv4 checksum over a packet
00397 
00398     returns the calculated checksum
00399     """
00400     import struct
00401     total = 0
00402     packet = ipv4.ipv4(self.bytes)
00403     packet.checksum = 0
00404     bytes = packet.bytes
00405 
00406     if len(bytes) % 2 == 1:
00407         bytes += "\0"
00408 
00409     for i in range(len(bytes)/2):
00410         total += (struct.unpack("!H", bytes[2*i:2*i+2])[0])
00411 
00412     total = (total >> 16) + (total & 0xffff)
00413     total += total >> 16
00414 
00415     return ~total & 0xffff
